utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: All right! Yes!! From home to the hospital in under seven minutes! We did it!!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yes, the hard part is truly over.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, but come on, we’re off to a great start aren’t we? I knew I’d get you here fast, but this has got to be some kind of a record!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh you made it!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: How are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wait a minute! How-how the hell did you beat us here?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We took a cab. Did you guys walk?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: N… No! We took a cab too, but I did test runs!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey! You made it!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay is there…some kind of magic tunnel to this hospital?!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross, you stay here and talk, I’m gonna go have a baby.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay. Okay. Umm hi, this is Rachel Green. I’m Ross Geller. We-we called from the car.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Right! We have a semi-private labor room waiting for you. So in just a minute…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Whoa-whoa-whoa-whoa! I’m sorry, semi-private? We , we asked for a private room.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Yes, I see that here. Unfortunately we can’t guarantee a private room and currently they’re all unavailable.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Man, if only you’d gotten here sooner.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: I’m sorry. Semi-private rooms are all we have.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Just give us a second. Ross!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Give her some money.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I really think they’re out of rooms.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: They’re not!! Ross, they’re just saving them for the important people!! Okay?! What-what if I was the president?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well then we’d be in a lot of trouble, you don’t know where any countries are. Okay. Uh, say would you umm… Would you mind checking again to see if any umm, private rooms may have opened up?

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: This is a hospital.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay. Y’know what? I’d have to say I really don’t care for your tone. And this is not the only hospital in this city and we have no problem to—Whoa! Oh gosh! Whoa!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What-what?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ow! Ow! Contraction. Ow-ow! Ow-ow!

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Would you like to see a semi-private room?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah, it couldn’t hurt to look.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Long
utterance.content: Well you’re only two centimeters dilated and we need to get to ten. It’ll be a while.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, okay.

utterance.speaker: Dr. Long
utterance.content: I’ll be back in an hour to check you again.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Thank you. Well, I guess we have some time to kill.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, guess so. Whew! Check these out! Never done this before.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah well it looks great!

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Thank you very much.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi! Hi, I’m uh Ross. I’m here to ruin this magical day for you.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Oh no-no, not at all.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Don’t worry about it.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Marc Coreger, this is my wife Julie.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi Julie.

utterance.speaker: Julie
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: This is Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Marc
utterance.content: Oh hi Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: How are you?

utterance.speaker: Julie
utterance.content: Hi. Is this your first?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah it is.

utterance.speaker: Julie
utterance.content: Well, little Jamie here is our third. So, if you have questions or you need anything at all, just holler.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: That’s so sweet.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Umm say, I-I opened this earlier but let me give you guys some privacy.

utterance.speaker: Marc
utterance.content: No nonsense! We’re all in this together.

utterance.speaker: Julie
utterance.content: Yeah, we are going to share every moment of this with you. And I think we’re gonna have some fun.

utterance.speaker: Marc
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, okay.

utterance.speaker: Marc
utterance.content: Hey! Smile!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no, I really don’t want any——Oh! Thank you. Oh. Oh Ross…

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Here comes another contraction.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh. Okay, just breathe.

utterance.speaker: Julie
utterance.content: Oh honey, I think I’m having one too!

utterance.speaker: Marc
utterance.content: Look at this! There we go!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh wow, three hours and still no baby. Ugh, the miracle of birth sure is a snooze fest.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hey, you wanna see something?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sure! What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Umm, this is going to be fun. Watch me freak out Chandler. Honey?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Listen uh, I-I’ve been doing some thinking, and I don’t know whether it’s because we’re here or Rachel’s giving birth but umm, I think we should try to have a baby.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What-what-what’s that now?!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. I’ve been thinking about it too, and I, I think we’re ready.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?! Are you kidding me?! You-you-you think we’re ready to have a baby now?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, this is fun.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You’re ready to have a baby? My boy’s all grown up!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: But you said you were ready too.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah but I was just screwing with you to try to get your voice all high and weird like mine is now!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, but haven’t you wanted a kid like forever?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, just back off mister! Whoa. ‘Cause I am ready to have a baby. I just want Joey to be the father.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What?! Are you crazy?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: That’s it! Right there! Is all I wanted!

utterance.speaker: Marc
utterance.content: I am so sorry. The doctor insisted on closing the curtain for the exam.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, that’s very—Really very-very okay.

utterance.speaker: Marc
utterance.content: Julie’s cervix is dilated a seven centimeters, that’s about four fingers. The doctor let me feel it myself.

utterance.speaker: Julie
utterance.content: Have you felt Rachel’s cervix Ross?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I don’t think we’ll be doing that.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: We’re not gonna do that.

utterance.speaker: Julie
utterance.content: Well, if you like you can feel Rachel’s and then feel mine to compare.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Am I interrupting?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh yes! Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh. Oh wait no.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Later.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No-no-don’t! Don’t leave me here with these people.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh uh, I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No Ross! Ross! Ross! My child has no father!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi! I’m so glad you’re here, but it’s gonna be a while. I-I wished you’d called first.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh that’s all right, I’m coming back later with your father.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh good.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: I actually needed to talk to you before the birth.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, what’s up?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: I brought something that I want to give you, assuming of course that you want it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ma, you’re asking me to marry you?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: This is your grandmother’s engagement ring, I want you to give it to Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mom no, come on! Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Just hear me out!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: N-no! Okay? We’ve been through this! We’re not gonna get married just because she’s pregnant, okay?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Honestly! Ross, this isn’t just some girl you picked up in a bar and humped. A child should have a family.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Mom, y’know what? I-I can’t deal with this right now. I’m sorry…

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Just…think about it. If you don’t, I’ll talk more about humping.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Gimmie!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh hi dear!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, thank you so much for coming. Ross, get in here!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: …she came and dragged me out of the labor room to ask me why I’m not with Rachel.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. Why aren’t you with Rachel?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Are you kidding? Look, we’re not gonna be together just because we’re having a baby. Okay?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But y’know what? It just seems that you two belong together.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, stop it! I can’t deal with this right now. I have to go have a baby.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Right. And with who again?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: God. He’s crazy! Why doesn’t he want to be with Rachel?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I know!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I mean seriously, she’s like the perfect woman. I mean I know she turned me down, but if she hadn’t and wanted to be with me, I would take her in my arms and… I haven’t bummed you guys out like this in a while have I?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey. Who’s that?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: New people.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What happened to the Disgustingtons?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: They’re having their baby! It’s not fair Ross we got here first! Right after you left they wheeled her off into delivery. Oh but not before she gave me a juicy shot of little Jamie just crowning away.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wow! Sorry. So uh, how are the new people?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well they have uh, some unusual pet names for each other. Including umm, evil bitch and uh, sick bastard. Oh God oh! Contraction!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah? Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh! Ow!!

utterance.speaker: Evil Bitch
utterance.content: Are you looking at her?!

utterance.speaker: Sick Bastard
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Evil Bitch
utterance.content: Don’t you look at her you sick bastard!

utterance.speaker: Sick Bastard
utterance.content: Honey I swear! I wasn’t looking at her!

utterance.speaker: Evil Bitch
utterance.content: She’s in labor! You like that you sick son of a bitch!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Umm. Umm, I’m-I’m just gonna—

utterance.speaker: Evil Bitch
utterance.content: See? See? It was because you were looking fat pervert!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No-no, I’m…I’m sure no one was looking. Just want some privacy.

utterance.speaker: Evil Bitch
utterance.content: You miss your girlfriend?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Just ignore them.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ross.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What? What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: He’s looking at me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey! You wanna live to see your baby?!

utterance.speaker: Evil Bitch
utterance.content: Don’t you talk to my husband like that you stupid bastard!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh good God! If you want a baby so bad just go steal it!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What is going on with you? Since when are you so crazy about babies?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m not crazy about babies. I’m crazy about us.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Look, we’ve always talked about having babies someday. I’m not saying it has to be right now, but I’m starting to think that we can handle it. We’re good. We’re really good.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We are pretty good.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: But nothing has to happen until your ready.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well maybe I’m ready now. I mean, it’s a little scary, but maybe it’s right.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?! It’s not right! We’re not ready to have a kid now!!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?!!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m kidding. This is going to be fun.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So we’re gonna try? I mean, are we trying?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: We’re trying to get pregnant. Y’know I’m not really comfortable doing this in front of the babies. So, when do you want to start trying?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, hold on a sec.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Period math?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, we could start trying. Now.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Right here?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, not here. Maybe here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wait a minute, it’s perfect. We got a lot of time to kill and we’re in a building that’s full of beds!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And it’s so clean!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Come on you stupid machine! Come on!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, it ate your money?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right, I’ll see you downstairs then.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey I got one! I got one!

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Oh uh, up or down?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh down please. I-I hate to be a ball buster can I just do it?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Could you press up too please?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Sure! I feel so bad for you; I broke my leg once too.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Oh yeah? How’d yours happen?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, it’s a long story. It’s kind of embarrassing. Let’s just say there was a typographical error with a sex manual. How about you?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Car accident.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Oh, let me guess some idiot on a cell phone wasn’t paying attention?

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Yeah. Me. Oh hey, that’s me. Hey uh, I take it you’re just visiting someone.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Uh-huh, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Well umm, if you have sometime y’know and maybe you might want to visit someone else…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh yeah! I-I would like that.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: I’m in the middle…

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait! What?! No!! Elevator!! No!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, you gotta press the button.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: The nurse said they’re bringing in another woman.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ugh, is she pregnant yet? She doesn’t need to be; she’ll still have the baby before I do. Oh Ross, another contraction!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: That’s it. That’s it.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Oooh, that sounded like a bad one.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah it was.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Mine haven’t been so bad. Oh! Here comes one now. Oh, that was a big one!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Excuse me? Could you help me with something? The patient I’m looking for has a broken leg and is in a wheelchair. And umm, he’s like early to mid-thirties, very attractive.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: I think I know who you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh yay! Great! Okay, what room number is he in?

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: I’m sorry, that information is restricted to hospital staff…

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, she’s with me. Dr. Drake Remoray.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: Dr. Drake who?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Remoray. It’s Portuguese. We need that information; I’m a doctor.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: A doctor at this hospital?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Damnit woman we’re losing precious time! Now do you want this man’s blood on your head?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hands.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hands! It is absolutely essential that you tell me what room the man my assistant described is staying in. He’s a patient of mine, I’ve been treating him for years!

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: He’s in room 816.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: 816, thank you!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: And what is his name?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I think we found a place.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Umm, wait! Do you want to set the mood a little?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Okay. Uh, we’ll dim the lights, dim the lights. Or turn them out all together. Uh, no scented candles. Okay here. Here we go.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay! Okay! Make me sterile, but okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay. Let’s hurry—Oh wait! Do we have a condom? Oh right!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, 98.6. You’re gonna be fine.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, this is it! Oh, that’s him! That’s him!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Great! Go get him.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wait a second, or maybe you can go in first.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: He’s not really my type.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: No not you, Dr. Drake Remoray. You can ask him questions and see what’s he like. People tell doctors everything.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: But you said he was this great guy!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But lately all the guys I meet seem really nice at first, then they turn out to be the biggest jerks.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You do attract some stinkers.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Dr. Long, I’ve been at this for seventeen hours! Three women have come and gone with their babies, you gotta give me some good news! How many centimeters am I dilated? Eight? Nine?

utterance.speaker: Dr. Long
utterance.content: Three.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Just three?! I’m dilated three!

utterance.speaker: Dr. Long
utterance.content: We are moving along, just slowly. Don’t worry, you’re doing great. I’ll be back soon.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey, y’know what? I’m not waiting! I’m gonna push this baby out! I’m doing it! I mean it’s what? Three centimeters? That’s gotta be like this!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Actually it’s more like this.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh stupid metric system!

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: Oh my. We’re gonna need to take you straight to the delivery room.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh for the love of God!

utterance.speaker: Woman Giving Birth
utterance.content: It’s coming! It’s coming!

utterance.speaker: Doctor
utterance.content: And here it is!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh come on!!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hi! I’m Dr. Drake Remoray and I have a few routine questions I need to ask you.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Really? I’ve been dealing with Dr. Wells.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know, but I’m a neurologist. And just to be on the safe side, Dr. Wells wanted a more comprehensive overview of you status so he sent me.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Dr. Wells is a woman.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: That was a test. Good response. All right, full name.

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Clifford Burnett.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Date of birth?

utterance.speaker: Cliff
utterance.content: November 16th, 1968.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Age?

utterance.speaker: Cliff
utterance.content: Can’t you figure that out based on my date of birth?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m a doctor Cliff, not a mathematician.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay. And uh, are you married.

utterance.speaker: Cliff
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh really? So, 33 and still single, would you say you have commitment issues?

utterance.speaker: Cliff
utterance.content: Are all the questions this personal?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Cliff
utterance.content: Well uh if you must know I’m a widower.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh that’s terrible. I’m-I’m really sorry.

utterance.speaker: Cliff
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hmm. Do you sleep with women and never call them again?

utterance.speaker: Cliff
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Excellent! Excellent! And uh, finally, are you into any weird stuff y’know, sexually?

utterance.speaker: Cliff
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oooh, wrong answer.

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: This room’s available.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay! Okay wait! You listen to me! You listen to me! Since I have been waiting four women, that’s four, one higher than the number of centimeters that I am dilated, have come and gone with their babies! I’m next! It’s my turn! It’s only fair! And if you bring in one woman and she has her baby before me I’m going to sue you! Not this hospital, I’m going to sue you! And my husband he’s a lawyer!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh Rach…

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Go get back on that case honey!

utterance.speaker: Nurse
utterance.content: I don’t think the next patient is very far along.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, well then bring her in.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: OH….MY….GAWD!!!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: I….can’t….believe this!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And yet somehow it’s true!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: I mean this is so great! We’re gonna be baby buddies!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Squeeze your legs together and cover the baby’s ears!

utterance.speaker: Man
utterance.content: Hi sweetie!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Hi! Hi sweetheart! This is my husband Sid, I don’t think you’ve met him. Ross, Rachel, this is Sid. I nabbed him a year ago at the dermatologist’s office. Thank God for adult acne huh?

utterance.speaker: Sid
utterance.content: I still can’t believe it! I’m the luckiest guy in the world!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Sid
utterance.content: What’d he say?

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh y’know what? You have to speak very loudly when you’re talking to Sid, because he’s almost completely deaf.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh there you go!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I get it!

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: So? Congratulations you two, I didn’t even know you got married.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh we-we didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No-no. We…

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Um uh…We’re-we’re just having this baby together but uh, uh that’s all.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Why?!!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Uh well umm…we’re just not in that place, y’know? But we’re very excited about this.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Oh. Well then shut me up.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Just tell me how.

utterance.speaker: Janice
utterance.content: Uh-oh, I feel another one coming.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sid you lucky deaf bastard.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: What else? What else?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, well he’s 33.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh. Ah-uh.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: A widower.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: He seemed like a stand up guy. Oh, and he’s not into anything weird sexually.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Enter Pheebs.
